com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.pipeline

Class QueuedReceivePipeline<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.pipeline.QueuedReceivePipeline<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Mutex, ReceivePipeline<T>

    @Synchronized
 @Tested(responsibleTest="com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.pipeline.EmptyReceivePipelineConditionTest") @Tested(responsibleTest="com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.pipeline.QueuedReceivePipelineTest")
public class QueuedReceivePipeline<T>
extends Object
implements ReceivePipeline<T>
    A queued ReceivePipeline implementation.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • addLast

        public ReceivePipelineCondition<T> addLast(OnReceive<T> onReceive)
        This Method adds a pipelineService to the tail of this ReceivePipeline

        Accepts an OnReceive interface, to add a handler to this ReceivePipeline.

        Upon calling this Method, this ReceivePipeline, will handle and processes the OnReceive and then link it to a ReceivePipelineCondition, which is then returned and may be manipulated by the developer.

        This ReceivePipelineCondition is responsible for defining whether or not the so added OnReceive is executed upon calling the ReceivePipeline.run(Connection, Session, Object).

        Every OnReceive encapsulated this way has its own ReceivePipelineCondition. You may add any number of Predicate to it.

        Specified by:
        addLast in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Parameters:
        onReceive - the OnReceive, which is added to this ReceivePipeline to handle the defined Object
        Returns:
        a ReceivePipelineCondition, to describe whether or not the pipelineService is executed upon calling ReceivePipeline.run(Connection, Session, Object)

      • addLast

        public ReceivePipelineCondition<T> addLast(OnReceiveSingle<T> onReceiveSingle)
        This Method adds a pipelineService to the tail of this ReceivePipeline

        Uses the OnReceiveSingle instead of the OnReceive interface.

        Specified by:
        addLast in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Parameters:
        onReceiveSingle - the OnReceiveSingle, which is added to this ReceivePipeline to handle the defined Object
        Returns:
        an ReceivePipelineCondition, to describe whether or not the pipelineService is executed upon calling ReceivePipeline.run(Connection, Session, Object)
        See Also:
        ReceivePipeline.addLast(OnReceive)

      • to

        public ReceivePipelineCondition<T> to(Object object)
        Links a real Method to handle the object (and the Session, Connection), if it arrives.

        The behaviour upon calling this Method is described by the internal ReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy, which can be set by the ReceivePipeline.setReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy(ReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy).

        The registered Method may accept any of the following Objects:

        • T, the object which is received over the Connection
        • The Session, responsible for the Client, which send the Object
        • The Connection over which the Object T has been received.

        The sequence of the declared Methods does not matter, you may declare the Object first, followed by the Session, or only the Connection.

        For correctly detecting the Method, the ReceivePipeline requires you to add the @ReceiveHandler Annotation to the Method, which should handle the receiving of the Object

        It looks something like this: 

        
 class TestObjectHandler {
      @ReceiveHandler
     private void handle(TestObject testObject, Session session) {
         // Do something
     }
 }

 class Register {
     private CommunicationRegistration registration;
     private TestObjectHandler handler = new TestObjectHandler();
     ...

     public void registerObjects() {
         communicationRegistration.register(TestObject.class)
                   .to(handler);
     }
 }

        Note that the @ReceiveHandler Annotation is commented out to ensure the correct JavaDOC parsing.

        WARNING: This method needs to use Reflection to find the correct Method!

        Specified by:
        to in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Parameters:
        object - the Object, which contains the Method to handle the receiving of the Object, which is annotated with @ReceiveHandler
        Returns:
        and ReceivePipelineCondition to specify if the linked Method is executed

      • isSealed

        public boolean isSealed()
        Describes, whether or not this ReceivePipeline is sealed.

        By default a ReceivePipeline is not sealed

        Specified by:
        isSealed in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Returns:
        true, if this ReceivePipeline is sealed using the method ReceivePipeline.seal(), else false

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Describes, whether of not this ReceivePipeline is closed.

        By default a ReceivePipeline is not closed

        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Returns:
        true, if the ReceivePipeline is sealed using the method ReceivePipeline.close(), else false

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Describes whether or not this ReceivePipeline is empty

        If either no instance of the OnReceive-Family has been added to this ReceivePipeline or the Method ReceivePipeline.clear() has been called, this Method returns true.

        By default a ReceivePipeline is empty

        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Returns:
        true, whether or not this ReceivePipeline is empty or not

      • ifClosed

        public void ifClosed(java.util.function.Consumer<ReceivePipeline<T>> consumer)
        Executes a provided Consumer over this ReceivePipeline, if it is closed.

        It tries to execute the parameter directly and does not store it.

        Specified by:
        ifClosed in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Consumer, which should be executed if the ReceivePipeline is closed

      • ifClosed

        public void ifClosed(Runnable runnable)
        Executes a provided Runnable if it is closed.

        It tries to execute the parameter directly and does not store it.

        Specified by:
        ifClosed in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Parameters:
        runnable - the Runnable, which should be executed if the ReceivePipeline is closed

      • setReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy

        public void setReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy(ReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy receivePipelineHandlerPolicy)
        Updates the ReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy of this ReceivePipeline.

        The given ReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy describes the behaviour of the Method ReceivePipeline.to(Object), whenever an Object-Handler is registered.

        The new ReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy takes affect at the next call of ReceivePipeline.to(Object)

        Specified by:
        setReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Parameters:
        receivePipelineHandlerPolicy - the ReceivePipelineHandlerPolicy to be used within this ReceivePipeline

      • remove

        public void remove(OnReceive<T> pipelineService)
        Removes a certain OnReceive from this ReceivePipeline.

        This Method is very work intensive, since it has to search every single registered element and compare each of the so registered OnReceive, OnReceiveSingle and OnReceiveTriple. It would be faster to clear this ReceivePipeline and redeclare each other OnReceive-Handler

        Specified by:
        remove in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Parameters:
        pipelineService - the OnReceive which was added to this ReceivePipeline and now should be removed

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all registered OnReceive-Family from this ReceivePipeline.

        After this method is finished, ReceivePipeline.isEmpty() will return true

        Specified by:
        clear in interface ReceivePipeline<T>

      • run

        public void run(Connection connection,
                Session session,
                T t)
        Runs a certain T through this ReceivePipeline.

        It will check every ReceivePipelineCondition, to see whether or not the so registered OnReceive will be executed

        Specified by:
        run in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Parameters:
        connection - the Connection, which is associated with the receiving of the T
        session - the Session, which is associated with the receiving of the T
        t - the Object, which should be run through this ReceivePipeline

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this ReceivePipeline and stops all Additions to it.

        If this Method is called ReceivePipeline.isClosed() will return true and every call of addFirst or addLast will only trigger the CanBeRegistered.onAddFailed() method, which might be overridden by the developer

        Specified by:
        close in interface ReceivePipeline<T>

      • seal

        public void seal()

        Sets the ReceivePipeline to an unchangeable open-state. If you close and than seal it, it cannot be opened any more. This seal is permanent and makes the ReceivePipeline immutable.

        Note: If you seal an Pipeline, it will not get collected, by a CommunicationRegistration.clearAllEmptyPipelines() call. However, a CommunicationRegistration.unRegister(Class) call will still remove the Pipeline

        Specified by:
        seal in interface ReceivePipeline<T>

      • open

        public void open()
        Reverts the ReceivePipeline.close() call.

        If this method is called ReceivePipeline.isClosed() will return false and every call of addFirst of addLast will complete correctly.

        Specified by:
        open in interface ReceivePipeline<T>

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of handlers contained within the ReceivePipeline.
        Specified by:
        size in interface ReceivePipeline<T>
        Returns:
        the count of all ReceivePipelineHandler

      • acquire

        public void acquire()
             throws InterruptedException
        Acquires access over the object. If any other Object has access over the given Object, this Methods waits until the current owner calls release.
        Specified by:
        acquire in interface Mutex
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the waiting takes to long.

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases the access over the Object and invoking any waiting Threads.
        Specified by:
        release in interface Mutex

      • requiresOpen

        protected void requiresOpen()
        Throws PipelineAccessException if pipeline is closed.
        Throws:
        PipelineAccessException - if the pipeline is closed

      • requiredNotSealed

        protected void requiredNotSealed()
        Throws PipelineAccessException if pipeline is sealed.
        Throws:
        PipelineAccessException - if the pipeline is sealed
